results.title: Sri Lanka Bombings Live Updates: Police Arrest 24 as Death Toll Nears 300
results.abstract: The death toll in Sri Lanka rose significantly on Monday to 290, after a series of suicide bombings at churches and hotels on Easter Sunday.

results.title: What We Know and Don’t Know About the Sri Lanka Bombings
results.abstract: Coordinated attacks killed more than 290 people in churches, the largest targeted assault on South Asian Christians in recent memory.

results.title: Breanna Stewart Shows the Toll of Pro Women’s Basketball’s Never-Ending Grind
results.abstract: Stewart, like many women, plays overseas in the W.N.B.A.’s off-season to earn more money. But the endless season takes a mental toll and, as an injured Stewart shows, a physical one.

multimedia.caption: Breanna Stewart of the Seattle Storm is one of the W.N.B.A.’s biggest stars, but an injury overseas will keep her out of the 2019 season.
multimedia.copyright: Jennifer Buchanan/USA Today Sports, via Reuters

results.title: Should I Warn My Daughter About My Abusive Ex-Husband?
results.abstract: The magazine’s Ethicist columnist on alerting a child to your ex’s bad behavior, what to do about condos turned into Airbnbs and more.

results.title: This Genetic Mutation Makes People Feel Full — All the Time
results.abstract: Two new studies confirm that weight control is often the result of genetics, not willpower.

multimedia.caption: Mutations in the MC4R gene usually lead to obesity by preventing a sense of fullness. But one such mutation leaves people uninterested in eating, scientists report.
multimedia.copyright: Susan Wright for The New York Times

results.title: Watch a Flower That Seems to Remember When Pollinators Will Come Calling
results.abstract: A colorful Peruvian plant dispenses its pollen according to a savvy, memory-based system, new research suggests.

results.title: High-Tech Collision Warnings, No Matter How Smart Your Car Is
results.abstract: “This can be a great way to get the safety benefit of crash-avoidance technology at a reduced cost compared to a new car,” said the author of a safety study.

multimedia.caption: The Mobileye system for older cars does not automatically apply the brakes in an emergency, but it does give audio and visual warnings.
The Mobileye system for older cars does not automatically apply the brakes in an emergency, but it does give audio and visual warnings.

results.title: How Low Should Blood Pressure Go?
results.abstract: Symptoms, rather than numbers, may best define when blood pressure is too low.
